publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1883 Mr John Swinney: Release of the Film "Finding Neverland"—That the Parliament welcomes the release on 29 October 2004 of the film "Finding Neverland" which charts the inspiration of J M Barrie in writing Peter Pan; welcomes the association of this film with Barrie’s birthplace in the town of Kirriemuir, Angus; pays tribute to the work of local historians and the local community to sustain the deep relationship between Barrie and Kirriemuir, and looks forward to the film generating renewed interest in the significance of Kirriemuir in inspiring the work of J M Barrie.
S2M-1883 Release of the Film "Finding Neverland" (lodged on 26 October 2004) Mr Andrew Welsh*
S2M-1883 Release of the Film "Finding Neverland" (lodged on 26 October 2004) Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Alex Neil*, Michael Matheson*, Donald Gorrie*

S2M-1883 Mr John Swinney: Release of the Film "Finding Neverland"—That the Parliament welcomes the release on 29 October 2004 of the film "Finding Neverland" which charts the inspiration of J M Barrie in writing Peter Pan; welcomes the association of this film with Barrie’s birthplace in the town of Kirriemuir, Angus; pays tribute to the work of local historians and the local community to sustain the deep relationship between Barrie and Kirriemuir, and looks forward to the film generating renewed interest in the significance of Kirriemuir in inspiring the work of J M Barrie. Supported by: Mr Andrew Welsh, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Alex Neil, Michael Matheson, Donald Gorrie
S2M-1883 Release of the Film "Finding Neverland" (lodged on 26 October 2004) Christine Grahame*
S2M-1883 Release of the Film "Finding Neverland" (lodged on 26 October 2004) Linda Fabiani*
